title: Job Vacancies at CasaLavoro Limited
content:
CasaLavoro Limited is a fast-growing company with diverse interests in Real Estate, Hospitality, Asset Management, and Agricultural Commodity Trading. We're committed to excellence and innovation, delivering top-tier services that set new industry standards. Our expertise and passion drive growth, reliability, and exceptional client experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Mechanical Engineer

Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for the design coordination, site supervision, and execution of all mechanical engineering services across Casalavoro Real Estate Limited’s mass housing and high-end residential projects.
	The role focuses on efficient, cost-effective, and durable mechanical systems that meet quality expectations for both affordable and luxury developments.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate and review mechanical designs for mass housing estates and high- end residential buildings, including HVAC, plumbing, water supply, drainage, firefighting, and gas systems.
	Supervise on-site installation of mechanical systems to ensure compliance with approved drawings, specifications, and Casalavoro quality standards.
	Ensure mechanical solutions are optimized for cost, durability, ease of maintenance, and energy efficiency, particularly for large-scale housing developments.
	Liaise with architects, structural engineers, electrical engineers, and project managers to ensure seamless integration of mechanical services.
	Prepare mechanical work schedules, material take-offs, and cost estimates insupport of project budgeting and procurement.
	Monitor contractors and subcontractors, ensuring workmanship quality, adherence to timelines, and compliance with HSE requirements.
	Conduct regular site inspections, identify defects or deviations, and ensure timely corrective actions.
	Participate in testing, commissioning, and final handover of mechanical systems for completed housing units.
	Support value engineering initiatives, especially on mass housing projects, without compromising safety or performance.
	Prepare progress reports, technical documentation, and as-built records for completed projects.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 5 years experience


Others:


	COREN registration is mandatory; NSE membership is an added advantage.
	Proven experience with mass housing estates and/or high-end residential developments.
	Strong practical knowledge of HVAC systems, plumbing, fire protection systems, water reticulation, and building services.
	Ability to interpret mechanical drawings, specifications, and BOQs.
	Good understanding of Nigerian building codes and relevant international standards.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit MEP, MS Project, and Microsoft Office tools.


Core Competencies:


	Residential building services coordination
	Cost control and value engineering
	Site supervision and quality control
	Contractor and stakeholder coordination
	Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.


Working Conditions:


	Largely site-based across Casalavoro project locations within Abuja.
	May require movement between multiple project sites.


Remuneration
Competitive and commensurate with experience and capability.

Application Closing Date: 13th February, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@casalavoro.net using "Mechanical Engineer - Application" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary


	The Electrical Engineer will be responsible for the coordination, supervision, and execution of all electrical engineering services across Casalavoro Real Estate Limited’s mass housing and high-end residential projects.
	The role focuses on safe, efficient, and cost-effective electrical installations that meet statutory requirements and Casalavoro’s quality standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate and review electrical designs for mass housing estates and high-end residential buildings, including power distribution, lighting systems, earthing and lightning protection, ELV systems, and standby power solutions.
	Supervise on-site electrical installations to ensure compliance with approved drawings, specifications, BOQs, and project standards.
	Ensure electrical systems are optimized for safety, energy efficiency, durability, and ease of maintenance, particularly for large-scale housing developments.
	Liaise with mechanical engineers, architects, structural engineers, and project managers to ensure proper integration of electrical services with other building systems.
	Prepare electrical work schedules, material take-offs, and cost estimates to support budgeting and procurement activities.
	Monitor electrical contractors and subcontractors, ensuring quality workmanship, adherence to timelines, and compliance with HSE requirements.
	Conduct routine site inspections, identify defects or non-conformities, and ensure prompt corrective actions.
	Coordinate testing, commissioning, and handover of electrical installations, including load tests and functional checks.
	Support value engineering initiatives, especially on mass housing projects, without compromising safety or statutory compliance.
	Prepare progress reports, site instructions, as-built drawings, and technical documentation for completed projects.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree (B.Eng. or B.Sc.) in Electrical Engineering or related discipline.
	COREN registration is mandatory; NSE membership is an added advantage.
	Proven experience with mass housing estates and/or high-end residential developments.
	Strong practical knowledge of electrical building services, including low-voltage systems, lighting, power distribution, earthing, lightning protection, and ELV systems.
	Ability to interpret electrical drawings, specifications, and BOQs.
	Good understanding of Nigerian building codes, utility regulations, and relevant international standards.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit MEP, MS Project, and Microsoft Office tools.


Core Competencies:


	Residential electrical services coordination
	Site supervision and quality assurance
	Cost control and value engineering
	Contractor management and coordination
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills


Working Conditions:


	Predominantly site-based across Casalavoro project locations within Abuja.
	May require movement between multiple project sites.


Remuneration
Competitive and commensurate with experience and capability.

Application Closing Date: 13th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@casalavoro.net using "Electrical Engineer - Application" as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Executive Trainee

Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The CasaLavoro Executive Trainee Program (ETP) is a structured leadership development initiative designed to identify, groom, and prepare high-potential young professionals for future managerial and executive roles within the organization.
	Participants will gain hands-on exposure to executive operations, core business units, and strategic decision-making through structured training, departmental rotations, and direct engagement with the Executive Office.
	As part of the program, participants will rotate through key departments, including Legal, Finance, Human Resources, Asset Management, Sales, Real Estate, and Residence Operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Participate in structured executive training and leadership development programs.
	Support executive-level tasks such as preparing briefs, reports, presentations, and policy documents.
	Conduct research, data analysis, and strategic assessments to support management decisions.
	Attend strategy and management meetings as assigned and provide summaries or action points.
	Execute confidential assignments and assist in tracking executive directives.
	Lead and support strategic projects during advanced stages of the program.
	Demonstrate discipline, professionalism, initiative, and alignment with CasaLavoro’s values at all times.
	Perform any other duties assigned by the Executive Office or Management.


Eligibility & Requirements


	Minimum of Second-Class Upper (2:1) degree from a recognized university.
	Law and Economics graduates are strongly preferred.
	Age range: 23–28 years.
	Strong academic performance and evidence of leadership potential.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	High level of discipline, integrity, humility, and work ethic.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking abilities.
	Demonstrated interest in leadership, management, and executive careers.


Application Closing Date: 16th January, 2026.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and relevant documents to: hr@casalavoro.net using “Executive Trainee” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Graphic Designer Job at Multipro Consumer Products Limited




        
    

        
        Multipro Consumer Products Limited is the largest company in Nigeria dealing in Sales, Haulage and Logistics. MCPL was founded in 1996 as a fully owned company of the Tolaram Group. The first product sold by MCPL in 1996 was Indomie and since then it has played a seminal role in making Indomie a household brand in Nigeria. MCPL over the years has grown adding 13 brands in various categories comprising of Noodle, Snacks, Milk, Cereal, Oil, Homecare and Personal Hygiene.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Designer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled Graphic Designer / Communication specialist to lead our internal communications and social media efforts
	 The person will develop and implement effective communication strategies to engage our employees, foster a positive work culture and manage our social media presence.


Job Responsibilities


	Create effective communication strategies for the organization, coordinate external and internal communications flow (newsletters, social media etc).
	Design communication for company-wide announcement and build relationships with key stakeholders.
	Develop and implement internal communication plans and campaigns.
	Create engaging content for various internal channels (email, intranet, newsletters).
	Manage and moderate our company's website and social media handles.
	Develop and implement social media strategies to increase engagement and followers.
	Create and curate relevant, informative, and engaging content to drive engagement within the organization.
	Monitor and report on social media analytics and engagement metrics.
	Collaborate with teams to integrate social media into their initiatives.
	Ensure consistent brand voice and messaging across all internal and social media channels.
	Collaborate with Regional Training Managers to drive recruitment exercises through available applications.
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in internal communications and social media.


Job Requirements and Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in communications, Public Relations, or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in internal communications, social media management, or a related field.
	Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
	Strong understanding of social media platforms and their respective audiences.
	Experience with social media management tools (Hootsuite, Sprout Social, etc.)
	Ability to create engaging content and campaigns that drive employee engagement and brand awareness.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and project management skills.
	Technical Skills in the area of graphic design, usage of Canva and relevant tools and applications.

Mechanical Engineer Job at Adkan Service Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Adkan Service Nigeria Limited is a wholly indigenous construction company with a bias of undertaking construction projects essentially within the country. The reason for this nationalistic and patriotic bent is to join hands with others of like minds in other specialised fields in making Nigeria not only the pride of other nations but a reference point in Architectural designs and brilliantly executed construction projects. In furtherance of this mission statement, it is worth stating that all our completed projects can stand the test of time and can also compete favourably with similar projects elsewhere in the world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Engineer
     

            
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Mechanical Engineering or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in mechanical engineering, preferably in the construction or manufacturing industry.
	Strong understanding of mechanical systems, HVAC, piping, plumbing, and building services.
	Proficient in AutoCAD, SolidWorks, or other engineering design software.
	Knowledge of local engineering codes, safety standards, and quality regulations.
	Excellent project management and problem-solving skills.
	Good communication and teamwork abilities.
	COREN registration or progress toward certification is an added advantage.
	Ability to work on-site and supervise technical staff as needed.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: adkangroupjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.
